WRITING.TITLE: The lead character in the last movie you watched is now your parent. What was your life like?

WRITING.TEXT: Yes this. Are you looking just to create graphics for your app/website, small elements (back buttons, home buttons etc) or redesign the whole thing? Is there an exisiting design or is it from scratch? Is UX important? I'm UX/UI too, but if you just need a graphic designer to create a brand, I can point you to some good freelancers.

Whoops, sorry just saw I broke the rules by posting this. You can delete it if you like.

WRITING.TITLE: Dear My Troll. Helloooo, Is it me you're looking for?
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]

I found out when I posted about being raised a Muslim and being a lesbian and it was [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/actuallesbians/comments/5gz0iz/essay_on_being_raised_as_a_muslim_and_knowing_i/?st=J2BUXGIV sh=3c076086) 149 days ago. If my creepy-Pm'er is reading this, then thank you. Posting your PM has now shared my story (and probably thousands of other people in similar situations) more. I'm sure this is exactly what you wanted. More people knowing that there are gay people who use to be Muslim.
Haha, this gave me such a good laugh. Thank you :)

I really wish they hadn't deleted their account. I would have loved to have a dialogue with this person. Are they upset because they are a lesbian? Are they a male who has a wife/child/friend that is a lesbian and they have to deal with that? Honestly, I just want to know, why take the time to look through my profile and find something I posted a while ago, (I posted ages ago about this, not recently) and hate on me about it.
Edit: [I hope he or she replies to my post.](https://www.reddit.com/r/actuallesbians/comments/69iqyl/dear_my_troll_helloooo_is_it_me_youre_looking_for/)
Edit again: they removed my thread, because it gives the troll attention. Oh well.

WRITING.TITLE: Someone is hating to me for sharing that I was raised a Muslim, no longer am one, and I'm a lesbian. Ok buddy...

WRITING.TEXT: Hey, I'm a UX/UI designer, so most of my contacts are in the area of web and app development, but I'm sure there are meet ups for engineers such as yourself. I have a friend who studied something very similar to you, so I'll ask him if he knows of anything.
Send me a PM and if you have Facebook I can add you to the Sydney startups group.
Went here recently as well. It was a lot of fun!
Looky looky I gotta hooky.

I was raised as a Muslim, but from a very young age, I realised I was gay. I tried to hide it with religion but it didn't help and I hated myself everyday. When I was 15, I started having feelings for my best friend. She returned the feelings and we had to keep a secret. Her parents found out and flipped, not because we were a same sex couple, but they thought that my parents would find out and blame their daughter. They forbid us to see each other, but of course, as teenagers, we kept seeing each other. It was really hard keeping it a secret. When we were 18, she broke up with me and started dating a guy. I was pretty heartbroken and we didn't speak for a long time. It's been about 15 years since we broke up, I still consider her a friend and we talk occasionally. I'm now dating an amazing woman whom I love very much, and she's with her boyfriend who she loves.
TL;DR had a secret lesbian relationship with my best friend and had to hide it due to religious parents. Broke up after 3 years, its been 15 years and we are still friends.
I realised that she's the only person that I've been with that I knew I didn't want to change anything about her. She was perfect. I even loved her things other people would consider "flaws".
New Zealand

WRITING.TEXT: My parents use to help the Burmese refugees at the detention centres in our country, a lot of them were from here. The stories that they told...they were horrific. It was happening to all females, not just women, very young girls, as young as 6.

Nope, Sydney, Australia. And yes, I just saw a spider.
